text: So firstly I just want to say I did not read any reviews on this hotel before booking or after until I am now back from holiday.I'm so glad I didn't.We got to the hotel at around 10.30am, we couldn't check into our room until 3pm, did that matter no - there was a dressing room to get Changed into, the front desk checked you in gave you, the band to wear so we could still eat and use facilities until our room was ready and you could put your luggage in their holding area.When the room was ready they called your mobile to let you know..The weather was excellent when we arrived so we went straight for the pools.The out door pool areas are fantastic, so clean and options for every child's abilities, shallow and deep and if you don't have children there is an adult only pool.Staff fantastic.Drinks plenty of options although only one sugar free option if diabetic not so friendly.Food-we only stayed 5 nights so the buffet was our only option, massive selections only criticism was hot food was barely Luke warm, may need to look at the heat source where they are left out.Just to say I knew the weather wasn't going to be as hot for April, so this meant the pools were very cold, for a 4.5 star rated hotel would be great if you could heat them in the colder seasons of the year this would really up your game.I'm going to return again next year in July so won't be a problem then.Entertainment in day was great, the children's disco in the evening before the main event could be improved as was same songs and same dances each evening although really good for very young children, my 6.5yr old found this a little repetitive and preferred the more adult based entertainment. We thought the circus act was fantastic, and the Hollywood night. Some of the adultentertainment was still more children orientated so this could be improved.Overall though we had fantastic time and will be coming back next year.I hope when you read reviews you take the actual constructive criticism away and try to improve on this as some of the reviews I had read are very unfair reviews and do not reflect on how good you are overall. Special thanks to nicco for making my boy feel so welcome and included.See you next year!!!

WELL WELL WELL.... where do I start?  We had an amazing week at Jupiter. Every single day was filled with fun and smiles. ALL the staff were amazing, kind and very hard working! The rooms were always spotless. The restaurant and bar staff  always attentive. A big thumbs up to the animation team (aka bati cocos) who were beyond spectacular. Each and every one of them was professional, energetic, dedicated and really friendly. They really made our holiday exceed our expectations. I highly recommend this hotel who wants a unique family holiday.

Artbeat Rooms is like no other place. Great people, amazing atmosphere. You will get not only originally decorated room just in the city center, but as well information where to go to eat, what to visit and all other advises - priceless - if you don't know the Lisbon.

An impeccable Inn, quiet, staff with little care, memories full of heads, the whole family was delighted with this stay,I highly recommend this Inn, another trip to this place again is quite possible.Only small downside: our neighbours across the Channel who are culturally louder than the other nations of the world.

My team and I stayed at Vila Gale Ribeira this weekend past.  The rooms were lovely, very clean and I loved that each room was named after an artist with accompanying wall art to match.  The general staff, concierge, breakfast staff and the barman, were all some of the best I've ever had to deal with. Friendly, helpful, understanding and most of all, very human. The breakfast buffet was lovely, well planned and although the hotel was busy, you never felt crowded. They were happy to help me figure out the trams, and places to visit. Overall, a really enjoyable stay with very comfy beds. I cannot recommend the hotel enough.
Wonderful hotel can't say one bad thing about our experience. Our third time to visit and never any problems we will definitely be back

Excellent experience, a lot of fun for the children, Tio Bolinha and Tia Joana Banana are great entertainers üëè it should be noted that the meals are very good. I really liked the football field and Padel.The only negative point is the lack of comfort of the beds.
We booked the Calheta Beach Hotel , but on arrival there were  offered an \upgrade\" to the Sacharum with the promise this is 5 star
month: but we are very disappointed.We stayed in The Cliff Bay 5 star last year
year: and the Sacharum does not make the cut by a very long way.We paid for all inclusive
extracted_date_str: but got charged extra in the restaurants
extracted_date: they even charge to use the safe deposit box in the room
year_int: and charge for very ordinary films on telly.The food is below standard and the dining staff do not have a clue.Dining is all self service
column12: and on Saturday 200 extra guests arrived by coach
column13: causing a cue of 30 minutes just to get food.The tables are not set
column14: guests get up to scavange for cutlery on neighbouring tables
column15: and left over wine is offered when they realize you booked all inclusive.They have cleaners removing plates before you have finished the dish
column16: not bothering to replace cutlery.5 STAR ??????? I don't think so !The shower does not work
column18: and they charge by the day for instant coffee and teabags in the room if you booked all inclusive.To claim 5 STAR
column19: you have to be striving to be near Michelen standards
column20: but this is a joke.We will not return. Sorry."

hotel_name: Dona Filipa Hotel Vale Do Lobo
text: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 9 nights , the welcome is very warm and friendly as you expect .  We paid for an upgraded room which was lovely,but odd though that there is no extractor fan so room stays full of steam and doesn‚Äôt take the smell away from the looand was told we would get water and fruit and coffee everyday.  Well I would expect that from a 5 star hotelAnyway second day no fruit no more water and the coffee pods not replaced we were told. You have to pay for these. Not to pleased to say the least .  3 rd day we were left one bit of mouldy orange which Itook  down to reception and not even an apology just a look and they took it away .Anyway there is a lovely selection at breakfast but.  Most mornings we had to ask for Hot coffee this happened 7 times out of 9 , also a lot of the food bacon beans sausages are not hot atall. So be prepared to eat cold food with cold coffeeNow for the great part. Out last morning leaving.  Again cold coffee cold food and hair in my scrambled egg.  , not mine as I don‚Äôt have anyReally not a 5 star hotel in my opinion.There are broken tiles my wife tripped on outside the lifts should be repairedThe new pool is very nice and I have to say the staff are very friendlyAlso some of the decking around the new pool area has fallen away and some people slipped on this . Still not repaired after 4 daysAlso would of liked to have been told you can store your golf bags down stairs so me and my wife didn‚Äôt have to carry them 3 floors and through hotel every dayBeen here 4 times and we won‚Äôt be going back.  Ever

Fabulous service and always a fabulous welcoming smile from Joice, great beer served ice cold. Pool bar is open on time and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. Would be good to have access to some snacks throughout the day though. Overall a good hotel

Spacious apartment for me and my 2 mates, we booked a room with twin beds and sofa bed in the living room area.  I would say though that the sofa bed was not very comfortable and very low on the floor so this might not be ideal for some people.  We booked this on a room basis only for 4 nights but we did have breakfast for 2 of the mornings and for 7.50 euros it was reasonably priced.  Hotel is not as near to the beach as they make out but it was still not a bad walk and then for about 25 mins you can walk further to the other side of the beach and the old town.If you are after a quiet break in the sunshine i advise you go here out of season as when we went there were so many stag and hen dos in both the old town and the strip, I dread to think what it is like there in peak season.  The area is heavily catered towards Brits abroad with places where you can get English Breakfasts and watch Sky Sports so if this is not the type of holiday you want i would look at alternative Algarve destinations that are quieter such as Praia da Rocha or Villamoura.  On the whole though we had a good time, the apartment provided everything that we needed (comfortable sofa bed aside) and was a decent size

Fantastic hotel and staff. Fantastic food and drink. Will definitely come back again. Mohammed Mustafa and his team are fantastic. Beautiful views and excellent apartments. Great pool for kids and very family friendly.

date: Rome H Gwrote a review Jun 2018
text: Portugal, Lisbon, its classic cable cars, interesting artistic architecture, color tiled facades and the 1908 Lisboa Boutique Hotel, \you've got to see it.\"Lisbon is a beautiful city to escape whether it be a long weekend or a seven-day journey. Either way
month: it will be an adventure.Upon making my initial reservation through my well respected and talented team at Ultra Travel Service of Boston
year: I received a personalized welcome and thank you email from the hotel. (*UT)Subsequent emails were exchanged with Andre to familiarize me further with all amenities and any additional services or assistance¬†I might need and to personalize my experience. (*UT)As requested
extracted_date_str: my private ride was arranged and waiting for me patiently as my flight was delayed for over an hour. (*UT)A short drive to the hotel where I was welcomed by three smiling staff members. (*UT)- Checking in was swift with Andre' personally there to greet me to the 1908 Lisboa. (*UT)The room in which I reserved was one of the best categories at this property and with a spectacular view. (*UT)This particular room is round with a great view from every angle with a spiral staircase leading to a second-floor seating area with a complimentary mini-bar
year_int: and a classic turntable with vinyl from the 80's classics. (*UT)The bathroom in itself was ginormous It had a huge glass enclosed shower
sentiment_score: a soaking tub and a generous amount of local toiletries. (*UT)Within a few minutes
column12: the door rings and in comes a bottle of Port
column14: and the famously tasty Portuguese Pastel de Be'lem. (compliments of the management.) (*UT)The quaint bar located near the lobby has one of the most knowledgeable bartenders about Port Wine
column15: history of Lisbon and local insight. (*UT)Dinner at \"INFAME\" was great
column16: but I only wish the staff was a little more engaging and knowledgeable about the menu. Breakfast was served at the same restaurant with your typical breakfast fare on offer.The proximity to the city center and most of the tourist attractions are within walking distance. (*UT) Just next door to the 1908 Lisboa is \"A VIDA PORTUGUESA
column17: \" a boutique department store that carries unique artistic pieces. (*UT)On one of the evenings
column18: I received a surprise bottle of Port
column20: the same one I had told the bartender the night before I genuinely liked. (*UT)After every morning jog
column21: I was handed a bottle of water and a face towel by the front staff. (*UT) Although a gym is not provided
column22: being in such a beautiful city
column23: why would you want to workout indoors?On one occasion I noticed two elderly couples that were lost asking¬†Andre' for help in finding their hotel. Andre' not only assisted them with directions (in their native language of French) but contacted the hotel directly to tell them about their stranded guests and that they were on their way. (Way to go Andre')(*UT)On the morning of my departure
column25: Andre' made the effort of being there personally to say goodbye
column26: (*UT) as he had also prepared a breakfast box as to the early departure. (*UT)I chose this hotel with advice from my travel consultant
column27: and I might add I was not disappointed in the least.I was indeed made to feel as though I was the only guest at this boutique hotel (*UT)
column29: (*UT) a marvelous structure to admire from the street (*UT)
column31: a staff that treats you like an old friend(*UT).I will provide photos and videos of this journey and a link to property for anyone wishing to experience the adventure.As you will notice I'm using (*UNIQUE TOUCH- UT) throughout my writing as to express my personal feelings with my experience during a given journey. Because I consider myself a global citizen and a seasoned traveler who has an eye for fine details in life
column32: I have created this check and balance to give recognition and credit where deserved.As I so famously say Goodbyes are never easy unless you reply with: \"see you soon.\"Uniquely the 1908 Lisboa touched me wholeheartedly numerous times and received 21 UNIQUE TOUCH stars * from Rome H Geragonis- I LOVE IT!"

text: I passed there the festivities of Saint John with my friends and it was an amazing experience: the owners treated us like kings.As clean as your mother¬¥s house, super cute and amazing international environment.Highly recommended.Thanks for this amazing experience!

Booked here with Easyjet holidays to celebrate my husbands birthday. We upgraded to a junior suite which was lovely. Wonderful staff, very friendly and efficient. When we arrived Vanny went out of her way to make sure we were happy with our room. The ladies who clean are very efficient leaving everything nice and clean. A great hotel in a brilliant location. Thank you all for making our stay great. Would heartily recommend. Breakfast was more than adequate with a lot of choice and the ladies in charge of the food were quickly clearing tables and restocking where needed.

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: It‚Äôs not a 5 star hotel, location is great, clean , rooms are great, food is ok but maybe because it‚Äôs a small hotel. BUT 5 stars hotel need to have sleepers and some personal things and they don‚Äôt, you need to ask for it. No concierge only front desk and they need some energy. I even took my luggage up the stairs because there was no one at the front at 20:00.Please people wake up

First the good - These apartments are within walking distance of everything you would want to see in Porto.  The proprietress, Olivia, is very nice and wonderfully helpful.  The apartment was modern and very clean.  Now the downside - Our apartment slept six, but this worked only because we had two children who didn't mind sleeping on a sofa bed.  Six adults would not do well sharing this space.  Sharing one bathroom would be challenging too if you are not related - we were all family, so we made it work.  The hot water tank is small, so we had to be careful to stagger showers in order to share the hot water.  Truthfully, the upside far outweighed the downside and I would stay here again if I return to Porto.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Lisbon - Oeiras By IHG
text: It is a well located hotel for access by car and to tour Lisbon and surrounding areas. The rooms well (clean, comfortable and soundproof) the treatment of the staff very well and the breakfast buffet very very complete and good quality. Free parking is available on site.Within walking distance (about 5min drive) there is a very complete Shopping Centre with food court

service was ok, food also, but location was not so typical as for marriott hotel, as it was far away from anything. closest metro station was like 20 minutes walk, downtown even further. at least they had pool in the garden, so this was relaxing for 25-30 degrees celcius temperature :)

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Class and history hotel. Beautiful bouquets everywhere, very well maintained, very nice room, quality food and really extra breakfast

Our flight was cancelled so this airport was booked by the airline at no cost to us so I can't judge on the price, only on what Mariotte's usually cost at other places.  The passengers all arrived on a bus to register at once and the process by the two girls at the front desk was efficient and friendly.  They gave me a room with two beds at my request.  The only other positive was it was the most comfortable bed I've been in for a long time.  The troubles were when I wanted a wake up call for the morning.  They said that everyone from the shuttle bus would be woken up at the same time, one hour before it came.  I explained I had spent 8 hours sitting at the airport after a flight from the U.S. at which it took us 5 hours to get there.  We were exhausted and needed every minute to sleep before the next day.  We were unable to retrieve luggage from the airport so we had no new clothes or grooming supplies to use.  How much time would a person need to get ready?  One hour apparently.  Even though I finally talked the girl into writing down a wake up call time, we were still awakened out of deep sleep earlier than asked.  When I mentioned it to Ricardo in the morning, he came out to embarrass me in front of others in the lobby by repeatedly telling me it was their policy and I was wrong.  It's unbelievable that a person has no choice in what time to wake up at this facility.  The other big problem was that since we didn't get to our original destination hotel in Madrid, which was already booked, I wanted to contact them to let them know.  My wife and I do not own a cell phone so I wanted to use a computer to email them.  I was told that I would have to pay for minutes on the computer to use it.  I have been to the cheapest motels on the planet and they all have a computer to use.  We stayed at Novatel the next 3 nights and they had two for free use.  How can a place that charges so much, nickel and dime you to death?  We left before breakfast was served so can't comment on the contents.

Once more, been there July and August. Resort had improvements, got nicer. Good for families with small kids, or couples. Boat trip to the beach is relaxing and Terra Estreita beach delicious. This time a minus, as with full capacity some important details failed, better organization at breakfast and cleaning needed.Nevertheless a great time for holidays, with Tavira so close with so many places to eat and enjoy. Considering actual demand, sugest June and September.Yes, still recomend it strongly, as was there as a couple and with my son!Another important thing, when visiting Algarve: have a look at all cultural and musical programs for summer months, as you can enjoy a lot almost at no cost!Wish you all well.Lu√≠s Rebelo de Sousa

We had a fantastic stay here for two nights during the storm ladt night and the night before. Breakfast is among the best we have had. Staff is great. Rooms are great. The hotel itselfis just perfect. But we are not so fond of the restaurant. Food is Ok but I don‚Äôt think you get what you pay for. It is rather expensive. My tip is to drive 5 km to Sao Jorge where there is an excellent restaurant.

This lovely little hotel hotel is professionally run by people who really care about their guests. During covid I had an issue with my passenger locator form and could not get hold of anyone to help me with my issue. The lady held on her phone for a very long time to try to get through to TUI who were entirely unavailable!The rooms are clean and pool area spotless.  It‚Äôs in a great location

hotel_name: Valverde Lisboa Hotel & Garden - Relais & Ch√¢teaux
text: We were there for 6 nights. In A Junior Suite.The location, the room, the breakfast, the FADO was just great.Why not 5 stars, There were a few small issues with housekeeping.Strange. But getting soap, both liquid and the bar was an issue.Not sure why.Also, they took our corkscrew. After I asked about it, they brought it back. But it was just odd.

The hotel has a nice lobby, restaurant and pool area. Unfortunately that is the only bit of the hotel that reflects the Marriott standards. Often had to wait 15 minutes to get an elevator, room key failed to work on every occasion I returned to the room meaning another long wait for an elevator down, joining extremely long queues at reception then waiting for another lift back up. One trip took me 50 minutes before I was back in my room. They sent maintenance to look at the lock but it was not fixed. Whilst frustrating this could have been managed by the staff on reception however I was met with shrugging shoulders and blamed for keeping the key near my phone (which I did not do). The reception staff were extremely cold, unhelpful and unwelcoming.  Air conditioning in the room is extremely loud. Maintenance were sent twice to fix this and still not fixed. The club lounge is often over crowded so you lose all exclusivity. The balconies are just an empty space overlooking the dual carriageway.I live in hotels 10 out of the 12 months a year on business and have been in Lisbon for 3 months. There are much better hotels available in the area (e.g. the Sheraton). I would feel sorry for any holiday maker who books this hotel.I don‚Äôt take leaving a bad review lightly but on the last occasion my room key didn‚Äôt work the lady at reception muttered an insult in Portuguese at me under her breath. Clearly not aware that I have worked here for some time and could understand her this was the final straw and lead to me leaving this one star review.An extremely disappointing stay and I will be returning to the Sheraton for my remaining three months in Portugal.

I stayed for 3 nights in this wonderful hotel. The Patisserie serves delicious pastries & snacks in a stunning settingThe room interior design is outstanding  - the use of a large glass cube to house the wardrobe & bathroom is genius - the architectural integrity of the structure is preserved.The bed linen & toiletries are of a high quality.Air conditioning can be easily controlled.Reception staff were very welcoming & helpfulThe breakfast is superb a wide range on the buffet & an a la carte.The restaurant Blind must be tried - a memorable meal - culinary theatre.I hope to return

We had a two night stay here over Easter and it felt like a true 5 star hotel.The breakfast was very good, served in a room with a relaxing atmosphere. The pool/ spa area was very tranquil and the bar area had a good vibe. Rooms were consistent with the expectation of a 5 star hotel.Not too long to walk to the city centre, but taxis were inexpensive

taxi booked through hotel didn't arrive at airport.  only one bed made up, although had asked for 2.  Bathrobes thin, one  with a hole.  Slippers one pair male size, though our booking said clearly 2 females.  Ms Gouveia at desk  very offhand, querying whether we'd actually ordered taxi,  said office was closed would have to sort out in morning.  Next day she said there was no email specifying those details.  Luckily the following day when we had a copy of the email another very helpful girl was apologetic and refunded our excess fare.bathroom counter top was dirty throughout the stay and with no discernible extraction system. Room and kitchen well-equipped.  The glass dome over the entertainment lounge was just outside the door, so noisy at night.Poor Wifi.Trip could only be paid by cash.Very unpleasant smell outside entrance door.There were no obvious signs for stairs - an obvious safety hazard in case of fire or other emergency.  After searching on a couple of floors, I asked at the office and was shown a door along a corridor, which had no sign and did not look like a stairway for the public.I hope this has now been remedied and that other improvements have been carried out since our visit, which was a little before the date stated, as I have only just discovered this site.

date: manuel soares cwrote a review Aug 2025
text: Excellent room, very well equipped, spacious and clean. dinner 5 stars! I chose the tasting menu. very good breakfast, I loved the pool and the Service at the same

The view alone makes this a perfect spot.  Looking out at the cliffs and ocean from your balcony is one of the reasons to stay at this location.  The hotel is modern, has a spa, has a beautiful pool area and lounge chair area, has several eating/bar options, and is close to town.  The breakfast has everything: omelettes made to order, fruit, pastries, cheese, meat, mimosas, coffees, breads.  The staff are friendly and helpful, rooms are spacious and views amazing.  Good central location to visit most Algarve areas.

hotel_name: Reid's Palace, A Belmond Hotel, Madeira
text: Another high quality Belmond location. Perfection in every way. Our favourite was swimming from the sea level terrace, lounging by the pool and having cocktails in the evening with live music.Staff were beautifully attentive whilst courteously invisible.

hotel_name: Villas D. Dinis Charming Residence Adults Only
text: Beautiful, comfortable, and relaxing accommodation within minutes of the downtown core. Very friendly and helpful staff. Reasonably priced, and includes a great breakfast buffet. The staff kindly packed us a lunch on our last day given we had to leave early to catch our train. It was a lovely surprise! Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Hotel Covilha Dona Maria Affiliated by Meli√°
text: Just stayed 1 night, but hotel was clean and comfortable, and very conveniently right next door to LIDL grocery store. Good breakfast buffet. Comfortable bed.Had quiet room in 318. Underground parking was available.

For the first time ever my husband and I decided to go away for Christmas. Having been in Albuferia twice before in September, and loved everything about it, we chose Forte do Vale to stay at this time. We picked a 1 bed self catering apt, and we were delighted to find it was massive and very well equipped (except for a spatula which we bought for a ‚Ç¨1). Our apt (205) faced the front of the hotel but we didn't have any noise problems at all, maybe it was the time of year? As everyone else has said the reception staff are exceptional. We dealt mostly with Miquel and Gina and cannot praise them enough for their big smiles and friendly manner, not to mention their efficiency. Loved the bar, especially happy 2 hour, but found one of the bartenders to be a bit robotic. We like to have a bit of chat from those in the bar. Didn't try the restaurant, Flavours, this time but might do in September as we've already booked again!! This hotel is ideally placed between both sections of Albuferia although Old Town is a bit of a stretch to walk for us wrinklies. I loved my massage in the spa but do agree it's a bit tired looking in that area of the hotel, and unfortunately it was really cold in the therapy room! Maybe a revamp is on it's way as they are still updating parts of the hotel. Really had a brilliant time, can't wait to go back!!!!!!!!!!!

The public rooms are lovely, very nicely decorated and furnished, and a very impressive art collection. Our room/small suite was very comfortable and also decorated with style and good taste.  We did not eat at the hotel, preferring to make our breakfast in the room, the equipment provided was high quality, and eating in Funchal in the evening. The staff were all very friendly and efficient and the location is wonderful, a short walk/taxi ride into Funchal but far enough away to be quiet. It really is a very comfortable hotel. Our only disappointment was that the largest outdoor pool was too cold to use and the heated one only just warm enough on one afternoon during our stay - to be fair it was March. The indoor pool however was warm and never crowded. We are very happy to recommend this hotel.

date: Grace A Dwrote a review Jun 2019
text: Stayed in this charming guesthouse , named so not because it is a palace but because it is across from Crystal Palace Gardens . The gardens are very beautiful with breathtaking vistas of the city and river. Roosters , ducks , peacocks are roaming through the grounds , a delight for children.This guesthouse has a lovely welcome from Bruno , along with refreshing drink ( water , port etc) It is a converted old house , old stone walls etc , WiFi not excellent . Location of guesthouse ideal , 10-15 min walk to Square with 4 Lions fountain . Numerous buses pass opposite , going into town . Bus to airport is 1 min walk , to the right as you exit and around the corner ( 601) costing 2 eu/ per person. Taxi from airport was 27 eu ( save money , take the 602 bus from airport , the stop is outside this guest house !Lovely high ceilinged rooms , some with verandahs . Good air con . Beds firm .Coffee + tea making facilities in the rooms ( and complimentary pastries )Lovely place to stay esp to have more authentic local experience

We had an amazing 2 night stay on the hotel room side of Pateo Lounge Suites. There were 18 of us in total so we took up most of the rooms and I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone travelling to Lisbon. Great location, really clean and cool rooms all with different interiors. The front desk were really helpful, rooms cleaned daily and breakfast was nice with a chef making eggs on request. Great value for money in a cool part of lisbon.

The hotel has an excellent location, very friendly receptionists, restaurants and bars on the same street, metro station that connects to the airport in one minute, train station two minutes away, I will definitely return on my next visit to Lisbon.

We have just come back from a fabulous family holiday over October half term staying at Pestana Viking.Rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels each time - separate beach towels provided also which was fab!We had a sea view suit, nice clean room, lovely view. Pull out sofa bed in living area was a bit back breaking but the two queen beds in the main bedroom pushed together were fine for what we needed, also had sink & fridge as we were half board.Entertainment - there was a bar on site that had a singer a couple of times in the evening & they have a pool table with 3 other games.Food was amazing. Jos√© & his team were fabulous! Think I must have put on a stone in the week we were there!Sea pool outdoors was freezing as expected this time of year, indoor pool & hot tub were very slightly warmer but kids didn‚Äôt seem mind it. Nice sauna & steam room & nice little gym.Nice little head massage in the spa too, note to ask if they have any special offers on, I did & it saved me 30euros!Location was a bit sparse but did have a few little restaurants near by - the local Intermarch√© up the hill was fab for getting supplies. Stunning beaches on all sides. Nice bar up on the hill over looking the beach next to the church - take a seashell to add to the trees.Near by was Zoomarine which was amazing - we pre booked before coming as you can then book transport through their website to pick up directly outside of the hotel - for two days entrance it was ¬£188 for family of 4, transport for 1 day was ¬£40 there & back - we actually tried Uber for the second day & it was about ¬£10 each way. If you only book 1day at Zoomarine too you can book an extra day for 10 euros each whilst there!Dolphin experience is cheaper to book once there too it cost us 97 euros each - this includes free professional picture with the dolphin, the experience itself, hire of wetsuit & a towel gift & bag.There are multiple boat companies if you want to try & find dolphins on the wild & see the caves - you can book at the beach next to Pestana viking resort (boat ride approx 1hr) or you can get a taxi (12euros approx) to the marina  where the bigger boats all launch from (most about 2hrs+) plus there are some nice restaurants here too to make a day of it.You can get a land train to the next village that runs in front of the hotel - reception can give you the pick up times etc. it‚Äôs about 5 euros each but is a nice little journey exploring with the family.Old town is very quaint & pretty too if you are looking for something other than the beach & is a little away up from the marina.All in all would go back again & had a lovely time. Thank you to all of the staff, you were amazing x x

What an amazing hotel! From the moment we arrived until we left we felt welcomed and appreciated.Pool and pool area are clean and well maintained, the rooms have everything you need and the cleanliness is exceptional.Location wise it√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s perfect, nice little supermarket, bars and restaurants less than a minute walk.The main strip is a 5-10 minute walk away and you can walk to old town or get the little tourist train if you√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re brave enough.We had a great stay here with a little surprise by the lovely staff for my husbands bday which was really nice and much appreciated.Would definitely stay again if we were to come back.

We stayed in a pool view studio for 6 nights. For the price paid my expectations weren't too high but a couple of things were a bit of an inconvenience.  Firstly we did not have any issues with the staff, they were the best part of staying at this resort.  Celia was very friendly at check in and check out and even helped carrying my mothers heavy suitcase to our room. Claudia was great when dealing with our malfunctioning toaster and loss of electricity. She followed up with us the following day and was friendly and polite as well as efficient in acting on all our requests. Joao (maintenance) was also very friendly, replaced our toaster, got us an oven tray and had a great sense of humour. The staff made us feel comfortable and at ease. Unfortunately the hotel is dated and a few things need replacing. Our toilet flush did not work properly, our bathroom was very dated and had a cracked wash basin. The doors were damaged, the kitchen again very old and dated. Furniture looked newish but the television was very small with limited channels.  The pool area was nice. Wifi was fast in the reception area but you will need to hire a modem if you want access in your room. Parking is outdoors and plentiful, but not sure how busy it gets during summer.  There is a Intermarche supermarket close by, prices are very reasonable there.  The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Oura and Santa Eulalia beaches and 10 minutes from the restaurant 'strip'. I walked to the old town of Albufeira in about 30 minutes. It's 3km away. You can catch a bus or taxi easily if walking is not your thing. Would stay again but only because the staff were good. It's not their fault the rooms have not been renovated, this is something that management should address to avoid unnecessary complaints.

This was a fantastic place to stay! Just back from a two week holiday.Hotel is situated perfectly just outside the new strip and only 25 min walk to old town.  Plenty of beaches within walking distance.  Staff super and always willing to help.For price paid this is a hidden gem.  Although rooms and amenities are worn everything works and is all you need.   Rooms spacious and comfortable.  Pool is not as cold as people say, it is naturally chilled.  Although be careful the bath and shower can be very slippy following being cleaned.  The rooms are clean and towels were changed regularly for us and beds made each day with sheets changed twice.  Outside can be noisy at night with people returning home however this is not the fault of the hotel!Good places to eat!! The county cockeral kitchen which is left of the supermarcado above the hotel. Really well priced and great tasting food especially from their 2 for 1 menu at √Ç¬£13.95 - can't beat it!! be sure to prebook your table it is that good!!!Paulu's italian is another lovely place to eat.There is a chinese on the new town strip on the right as you walk up with 4 euro specials great food!!

In many ways this hotel was more than adequate situated as it between the Marina and the fishing port. It‚Äôs biggest plus is the quality of the staff who are friendly and helpful. One disappointment was the lack of food on arrival after a delayed Friday night flight and the inability to book a day room on the last day. We left at 6pm but had to clear our room at 1pm.The food is exceptionally good.

Quiet area, but plenty bars and restaurants nearby (and small beach). If you want to liven things up a bit, it's only couple of miles to the town centre. Excellent facilities at the hotel, you could spend all day there.

The air con in the bedroom is too warm and needs looking at, although the maintenance Man came and had a look at it.  The food was very bland and consisted mainly of chicken wings and crossed pork chops or small pieces of fish.  Very repetitive. The waiters were very miserable and never smiled. They didn't seem to be happy in their work at all. Receptionists were very good. The cleaners were very good. The room was beautiful but warm.

Location overseeing the shore line of Maderia is very nice.Friendly staff. Parking is included.Huge swimming pool and terrace.Amenities like hot water kettle is available at the front desk for your asking.Fresh baked bread for breakfast is a treat.Air conditioning takes a bit of learning curve to operate but otherwise fine.

Much has been said about this hotel and believe me you will not be disappointed. The hotel is small but perfectly formed.The hotel is kept spotless and the views over Funchal are breathtaking.Taxi from the airport was 18 euros although the taxi booked through the hotel for the return journey said they had an agreement with the hotel to charge 30 euros. After negotiation this was reduced to 25 euros.As said by others the 10 to 15 minute ( white knuckle ride ) local bus journey into  Funchalis only 2 euros but for a couple on a 2 week holiday this cost 112 euros.  You can of course use the hotel courtesy bus ,which is far more civilised ,but the timetable is clearly designed to keep you in the hotel in the evening. The last bus back from Funchal is 6.30 p.m.This hotel is excellent value for money and being small has its advantages.  We met some lovely people who chatted freely at breakfast,around the pool and in the restaurant and bar.Tommy and Maureen and Pat and Russell will miss the fun.Yvette from Switzerland will miss practicing her English.Adelaide serving the breakfast was so pleasant and keen to help.The hotel restaurant is good and we particularly liked Estrela Do Mar in the Old Town.  Sabor da India at the Lido provided a pleasant change with fine Indian Cuisine.This hotel provides a wonderful base from which to explore Madeira.

hotel_name: Porto Pal√É¬°cio Hotel by The Editory
text: During our stay, this hotel was packed with people who had been booted off of AMA Waterways cruising trips which were cancelled due to high waters on the Duoro.  With the exception of very well designed bathrooms, the hotel was only okay and not located within walking distance of the historic waterfront of Porto.  This is just a place to stay if you can't find something more well located and intimate.
Our room was extremely disappointing, particularly as we had paid 3 adult rates. We were given a double room and a \camp bed\"
month: which quite frankly for an adult in a supposed 4 star hotel is not ideal at all.The air con I had already read previously on Trip Advisor was not efficient
year: but ours was positively dangerous as well.It kept us awake by the electrical tripping noises it kept making and it kept spewing out either chunks of ice or water that wet the floor underneath.One night there was a power cut on our corridor
extracted_date_str: possibly as a result of the air con.We reported it at Reception and an engineer supposedly attended but it didn't improve
extracted_date: We recorded it on the phone and played it to the holiday rep but she wasn't unduly concerned.Cleaning also left a lot to be desired. the room was never cleaned before 5.30 pm and on the last day we were packing at about 5.50 pm when the maid arrived. We went to the lounge to leave her to do her job but when we returned the only cleaning that had been done was the beds being made
year_int: The bathroom hadn't been touched and the floors were unmopped.The reason for this was that there were still 2 or 3 rooms near ours still to be cleaned.Cleaning still taking place at this time prevents guests from getting ready for their evening meal

text: Very nice location. Very beautiful view. Nice breakfast and the rooms have a good size. Bed very comfortable and has air conditioning. The staff is nice, but not as attentive as they should be in a 4 start hotel, and that is the reason why I didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t gave a 5. They didn√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t know that we paid the room online before the check in, and asked to pay again without checking for exemple. They have games room, and bar, but both weren√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t open and the bar had no one to serve you, it seem that was closed.

just returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel and we were a bit worried after reading all the bad reviews . we had no need to have worried ,check in was smooth .the porter carried our luggage to the room which had a lovely sea view . we booked a standard terrace room which had everything we needed for a self catering break .we had maid service every day including fresh towels and bed change , happy hours for drinks at all hotel bars through out the day if your not all inclusive .2 mins from beach and a 10 mins walk to the strip and shops , there was a few stag and hens in the hotel but this was not a problem .overall a good stay and will stay again .

We stayed here 31 may-7th June. First impressions, hotel needs a good overhaul as furnishings and some areas dated and in need of a paint. We were in room 711 and the air conditioning did not work at all. We complained three times to reception who said Maintenance would check it out. Well I think like other things, this needs an overhaul too as our room was so warm even leaving the key card in the slot all day and night, our room was still warm. I hardly slept because of this! It annoys me when hotels state they have air con But when you arrive it just doesn't work!! In spite of this th staff are friendly, the buffet breakfast is good apart from the coffee, it's from a machine and full of sugar whatever one you choose!! The outdoor pool area is great, plenty of sun beds and no one putting towels on beds and reserving them from early dawn thank goodness. Because of the air con and dated areas I've marked 3 out of 5 but if you like a hot room then this isn't a bad hotel for a weeks break.

Casa Morais is a peaceful, very pleasant choice if you want to stay near Coimbra. You will be made very welcome, with ample advice to help you during your stay. The separate living room is a nice touch. Breakfasts are good. You will need a car to make the most of your visit as Coimbra is a 15 minute drive to the centre

This hotel has a lovely personal feel. We were greeted with a tour of the facilities and then taken to our room. The room was modern and super clean. The bed was extremely comfortable.The lounge was like being at home. Very comfortable.The breakfast was lovely and constantly replenished. The smell of fresh pastries drifted through the building.Free tea/coffee throughout the day with freshly baked cake as well as a (honesty) bar.Would definitely recommend.Town is a 10 minute walk away but 3 nice restaurants within a 3 minute walk.

Very well located, easy by car and less the 20 steps from the metro station, walking distance from Avis rent a car. Big room, very spacious, clean and well decorated, and supplied with everything: safe, hair dryer, mini bar, big tv screen. Breakfast has a lot of options, fresh fruits, eggs, and even Pasteis de Belem. Parking at a fair price $9,90 the entire day. Silent and quiet. Would be back.

We spend a couple of nights in beautifull Tomar at This nice hotel. From our balcony we had a panorama view to the knights castle which you must visit. It was value for money, really cheap. Everything at the hotel is a bit old. The room and bathroom was cleaned and the staff was nice

This hotel is nicely located in the town of Tomar, just 10 min walking from the center, near a nice park. This a great hotel for families. For a reasonable price, we got a suite with two communicated rooms and large bathroom. The kids were delighted at the play ground outside. The Templar castle is superb and walking in old streets around the cathedral feels nice, with great options for family with kids, like pizzerias and so on.

Everything was really good in this hotel. Clean, service was good, location is great. The only thing I missed was a gym and better Wi-Fi. The internet connection kept disconnecting and was quite slow. Not expensive compared to the location. I did however not include breakfast with my room and it cost 15 EUR to add that on site. That is crazy expensive compared to prices at the local restaurants.

We enjoyed our stay here from check in to check out. We had a wonderful room with mountain view. The English-speaking receptionist kindly checked the time of sunrise for a stunning vista to remember.The hotel is in an excellent location within the walls of Marvao with guest parking at the doorOur room was small but very comfortable with BBC world news the first in nearly 6 weeks. Excellent show with abundant hot water. A lift helped with luggage.Breakfast was very freshly prepared delicious fruit, cereals, breads and croissants, scrambled eggs, cheese, meats, jams more than anyone could eat with good coffee.From here we walked from end to end of Marvao and loved every minute.Thank you to our host and his lovely receptionist.

We really loved this hotel.We received a very warm welcome and our room' as I had requested, had a lovely view over the river and a balcony.The climb to the convent was a challenge due to roadworks and the entrance not signposted but it was worth it.The hi light of our stay was dinner in the dining room.It was superb and very reasonably priced. Afterwards we had a drink in the lounge while listening to a marvelous pianist. Highly recommend a stay here.

I have traveled to 45 Countries and this is my all time favorite hotel.  This not just a hotel, it feels like you are staying at someones home (small palace).  The rooms and interior are exquisite plus the customer service was exceptional, the grounds/ pool are breathtakingly beautiful, & the food was wonderful.  I honestly can't brag enough about this dreamy location.  I really hope someday we are able to return again someday :)

Couldn't recommend highly enough our stay At Casa Holstein de Sao Sebastiano, Sintra. The setting is sublime- away from the busy center- perched over a tree lined valley but easy walking distance to the center for fruit shops, restaurants, delicious cake shops etc The staff we incredibly lovely and  helpful the minute we walked in the door offering us a drink and snacks and offering to book our tickets online for the local attractions (to eliminate waiting in the huge lines!) Happy to store our luggage. Nothing was too much trouble! The rooms- clean , spacious, wonderful beds, outdoor balcony, great wifi. The included breakfast was comprehensive - hot and cold options (freshly baked orange cake was scrummy!) Thank you for a truly relaxing serene and beautiful stay. Highly recommend staying here a few nights to see everything in Sintra.

A bit pricier than other hotels of the same standard but not overpriced. The hotel sits on top of the dune right at the coast. Through the garden you can walk down to the beach, have a quick dip in the freezing ocean and warm up again in the hotel¬¥s outside jacuzzi. We enjoyed our time at the Mareta View!

Location - just across from sao sebastiao metro station. Just one train ride to and from the airport and about 10 mins via train to the main sights. There is a mall about 2 blocks from the hotel with lots of food choices and shopping.They let me check in early. Breakfast was the usual cold meats, cheese and bread. Good sized room, you have to pay a deposit to use the room safe and you get it back on checkout.

Fantastic stay, really well looked after and the staff made a real effort to look after us. We had massages in the spa which are highly recommended. The pool area was wonderfully relaxing and we will certainly stay again. September is a wonderful month, not too hot but beautifully sunny

We stayed two nights after a long trip from Belgium, what a great Pousada with good views of the city.An ancient hospital which was qualitatively renovated some 6 years ago with spacious rooms including all services.Very good central luminous court, with nice lounging area, and good breakfastGreat price quality balanceDo visit...

The guesthouse is in a great location overlooking the beach. It is spotlessly clean. Catia was incredibly informative and very helpful, excellent customer service. The breakfast served in the baskets was absolutely delicious. We would highly recommend the O Castelo.

Another pearl of heritage recovery. In the central area of Viseu, equidistant and close to the Rossio and S√©, there is another beautiful guesthouse from Portugal. Born from the recovery of a hospital, the closed cloisters are imposing, marked a central zone that gives access to various services, including the Bar on the central ship. If you can, stay in the rooms on the 4th floor, with large balconies, namely those that make the corner of the building.  They are spacious rooms, with imposing double bed and living room partition as a front chamber. The dark wood gives it a special beauty, with wide windows that give it plenty of lighting. They have a good spa and gym, with an outdoor pool for guest service. A good buffet breakfast, with regional products, where there was no shortage of the Viriato and the Bolo Real and the good cheese. The guesthouse has a private parking lot and an outdoor pool, which given the time of year we did not experience. As is customary in the guesthouses, but it is worth mentioning, a friendly and attentive staff, from the reception to the maids. An experience to repeat in short breaks or more for the summer.
